comment: He is well-versed in a lot of different mediums and is very encouraging and understanding. If you're having an issue, he is very easy to talk to and will absolutely help you if you put in the effort.

Allen is an incredibly nice guy and very knowledgeable and passionate about art, but often wasted class time talking about things over and over again or going on random tangents. Graded fairly with good feedback, and I appreciate how the class was structured well. Expensive class, but this is just how 3D class is, not really his fault.

Peterson was a genial but challenging professor. Disorganized and lacked clear grading criteria/comprehensive curriculum. Lectures always veered off-topic and ate up precious in-class work time. Projects, while interesting, were overly complex, expensive, and graded harshly. Critique days were egregiously long and demanded constant participation.

Professor Peterson isn't the worst art professor I have taken, but I'd advise avoiding his 3D Design class if you aren't wealthy and unemployed. He requires many expensive materials, at least $200, that the other 3D Design classes do not. You have to sink a lot of time into projects to get A's, so be sure to have lots of free time outside of class.

Professor Peterson is passionate at his craft but poor in his teaching skills. Serious time management issues; lectures are either intercut with off-topic rambles or cut short by the class end. Almost complete and openly admitted lack of experience with the 3D modeling program he tried to teach. Critiques are severely under-managed/unprofessional.

He is a very nice guy and knowledge about the art world. The class consists of 4 projects, 2 written quizzes ( terminology) + 1 essay. You learned different medias :melting metal, 3D printing, molding & casting. Materials can be expensive at KSU bookstore, but you can always get it online. He can be hard grade if you project is sloppy.

an absolute waste of your time and money. please find someone else to take for 3d. all he does is talk- has very minimal in class time for projects, does not properly allot time to help everyone, never gives a 100, and requires way too much work/time for a prereq. DO NOT BUY HIS BOOKSTORE KIT. YOU CAN GET THE MATERIALS ELSEWHERE SO MUCH CHEAPER!!!

Professor Peterson is a very nice guy and is very knowledgeable in what he teaches in 3D design. His class consists of 4 projects, a midterm and a final. He wasn't very thorough when going through lectures, they were very visual and picture based, not a lot of notes but you need to know all that information for the 2 tests. Good class overall.

Only 4 total projects but each one has around 3 steps which all get graded, Fun class, and interesting projects to force creativity and imagination, as an artist I feel as if his class has helped me to be a more critical thinker.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Allen is a nice guy but WILL WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY. His 3D Design class is by far the most expensive option, take this class with another professor if you can. He also takes up a lot of class time with lectures that are either common sense, or irrelevant stories. His critiques are very basic and vague, and no one is improving in this class.
This class was actually good. Professor was nice and understanding. Projects were a little challenging but overall easy if you follow instructions. Would recommend.
Great guy, super fun and interesting projects with a lot of room for experiments. Gives awesome feedback and works actively in his field. One of my favorite classes

This class was one of my favorites. I took the 9 am so I didn't like it at first but the professor gives you ample time to finish projects in class and gives clear guidelines.  Some projects are a little abstract but as long as you put effort in you'll be fine.  Was kinda mean to me at our final critic but I got a 92 so whatever.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: One of my favorite professors I've had, he was my 3D Design professor. The projects were unique and super fun to do. We had only two tests but if you study you can pass them. He does go on tangents about some really cool story's when doing the lecture side of his class but it just makes it better.

this teacher was one of my fav people ive ever worked with. hes inspiring and respectful and gives good feedback. he helped me develop my art significantly, more than the average class has. hes also super fun and lenient. he will work with you. 10/10 would recommend.

He's been very helpful this semester, and hasn't presented anything I would consider to be unfair, or too complicated or difficult to follow. Also a pleasant and nice guy to be around, and that can help when you're discussing things you're passionate about, like artists in an art class. Great professor, would absolutely have him again.

Mr. Peterson is awesome! He's one of the best art teachers I've had. I am currently in his fall semester class. We've done cool projects. There are two tests and a writing assignment, but they're only worth a small % of the class. I appreciate that he cares more about the art than the tests catergory. This is different than my other art classes.5/5
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I love him! Very funny, loves to talk and have open discussions. He does expect a lot more than other art professors but you can tell he absolutely loves what he does and has a love of art. He follows the syllabus to a T. Participation is huge in his class you will have to write a paper along with midterm and final.

I took him for 3-D design and it was one of the best classes Ive taken so far. He gives great feedback and hes very inspirational and you can tell hes super passionate about his work. He kept the class interesting and it was always a really relaxed environment to be in. Take him if you can, I am a graphics major but it open my eyes to sculpture

Took this as a gen ed. five pop quizzes (dropped lowest one), midterm, final, two papers on an artwork, 1 short individual art presentation. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Does not post lecture slides and lectures are long. Read the book or you won't pass the quizzes. Nice guy, just a boring class. Stopped taking attendance halfway through.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: he's a fun dude, and an artist himself. he teaches by the textbook, so reading it is an absolute must. he gives random pop quizzes, but they're real easy. there's a presentation required, but it's very simple and short. his passion for art is obvious and teaches effectively.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Allen's a madman and it's great. The grading criteria could be a little clearer, the feedback could be a little better, but he's passionate about what he does and it shows. I suck at 3D and I've learned a lot and feel way more confident in my ability after this class. Only group project is for the 10 ft inflatable, and it's a good thing actually.
Great professor with great knowledge about different kinds of art.

There are a couple of papers, a few pop quizzes (he drops the lowest one), a presentation, and 2 exams. He's a pretty funny professor and he gives out a lot of extra credit. If you read the book, it'll be an easy class. (A little aggravating that I finished with an 89.1, but that's on me)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory but there is pop quizzes, one which he will exempt. Took us on a few field trips, the art presentation which is the one major project was worth a pretty big percentage of your overall grade. Lots of bonus points given out, over 13 extra points could be earned on your midterm final.

I had his class over the summer and I had a great experience with him. He took us on two really interesting field trips and I learned so much from him. He was very fair and the people who didn't like him were the ones who did not pay attention or read the text like he asks. If you do those two things, I am sure you will pass and enjoy the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: He's kind of unorganized and doesn't always make a lot of sense. But he is really funny and caring. And he's also very passionate about bees?
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Caring

comment: I really enjoyed Professor Peterson and his class. It was very difficult to get into a groove, so to speak, in his class because it can be very unorganized at times. He is a funny and brilliant person who truly cares about the growth of his students. If you thrive in an organized learning environment, however, he is not the teacher for you.

I had him for 2D Design and I liked the class a lot. Yes, there are a lot of projects some of which take a lot of work. Yes, you have to learn some vocabulary. But overall I think he is hilarious and will work with you if you need help. He lets you be very creative which is nice.
Very good communicator and gives free guidelines to each project. Lots of room for creativity and class moves at a nice pace.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Worst teacher I've ever had the misfortune to have. Horrible grader, terrible instructor, and rude as can be. I highly recommend taking another teacher for this class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: One of my favorite art professors! Assignments are straightforward and the requirements for them are clearly spelled out in the assignment guidelines. Hes very helpful with any questions or problems you might encounter. Be prepared to stay busy though. I would take him again!

Terrible teacher in general. Has no idea what he is talking about. Gives pop quizzes over material you haven't learned yet. Tests are horrible. Take another teacher or if you can't just don't take the class or take something else. He is just plain terrible and expects you to already be an art major. I was just taking the class as a requirement.

He makes the class as if it's a senior level course. This 1000 level class is more difficult than any 4000 level class I've taken. He makes everything much more difficult than needed to be. Art should be fun and he makes me hate it. He takes the course too seriously and it's just a prerequisite class.

I had Peterson at 8am. If I walked in at 8:01am, he would count it against me. He gives an exercise to do for homework every class. Though these assignments were helpful and some fun, they were assigned at a rapid pace that made it difficult to keep up. He wasn't always clear with what he was looking for, but was very nice, charming, and funny!

Peterson is adorable and funny with a great personality.  He will keep you engaged and makes this rudimentary class interesting and enjoyable. He assigns a lot of work, but it's all fairly easy and doesn't take long to complete. Critiques were my favorite part of this class. Not many tests. Fair grader. Take his class.

He's a good teacher to a certain level. He gives vocab tests so being in class is almost mandatory. The midterm and quizzes were just vocabulary words. I never understood his explanations of the assignments and projects but so far I've managed to make lows c's to high b's on them. Again he's an okay teacher.

Peterson's ART1100 course is easy and fun. He allows his students to be as creative as they want with no limits, and gives good feedback during critque. He gives pop quizzes, but he hints when it will be taken. He is absolutely hilarious and I would take him again. The kit he requires you to buy is expensive, but it's art school so it's no surprise
